website_summaries.verdict: Highly successful design for a boot dryer that delivers results in a few hours.
pros: Long-lasting device that'll keep your boots and shoes dry
Works faster than other models in this price range
Simple design that has been proven over time to work effectively
Works with all types of footwear materials safely
cons: Wide boots may not fit well
Only two drying posts on the unit

customer_reviews.title: Slow and took forever
customer_reviews.text: This dryer literally took forever to dry my shoes, I had it turned on for an hour and realized that it was not even warm at all. Left it overnight and my shoes were still wet. people said it will take 12 hours to dry. This product is not cheap and I was expecting fast and excellent performance. Overall very disappointed with the speed and how it works. Returned for something that works and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dear MR.J

customer_reviews.title: Great Item for Hard Workers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two reasons: 1) Dry out and have warm boots for the cold mornings and 2) keep the form on myboots. Just place the boots on overnight and in the morning you'll have warm and dry boots. Simple. Eventually, the wrinkles in my boots should go away or at least not get worse. Plenty other reviews mention this not having an on/off switch, which would be nice, but I just unplug mine after I take the boots off. Might put a simple switch in some day. I also bought theto better dry gloves. Just placing gloves on the boot dryer as-is doesn't work well, especially since I typically want gloves dried quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: Melted after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the dryer for my partner. Worked beautifully for the first few uses. My partner had purchased all the correct adapters as advised to do so by several different suppliers of this product which worked perfectly until we found the plastic tubes had both melted and collapsed after several hours of the dryer being in use. Sad times, and right at the beginning of the shooting season.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Jones

customer_reviews.title: It works, actually heats the boots somehow
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical for the "no moving parts" thing. Also concerned for energy usage because I'm a cheapskate when it comes to that electric bill. But some sorcery allows for this thing to have no moving parts, low energy consumption, AND the boots are hot in the morning. No more wet toes before I even leave the house. I read a lot of reviews of people whining about not having an on off switch or having to unplug it to turn it off. I thought it was a legitimate concern before purchasing but have now determined that it was just whining. I have two pairs of boots anyway so there's always one pair on it. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Public name (required)

customer_reviews.title: A FANTASTIC 5 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ STAR PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my husband who is a mason worker. This works fantastic! After a long day working in the rain, his boots are soaking wet. The next morning his boots are completely dry and toasty warm. He is sorry that he hasn't asked for this a long time ago. Also works great on sneakers & slippers as well. Both myself & my husband give this product 5 stars! Product was also well packaged and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Have no doubt!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t doubt this dry, seriously. I was very hesitant at not being able to hear it and there being no forced air happening. But this truly truly truly! dries amazingly! I have ariat work boots I work average of 12 hours a day 6 days a week, so yes my boots get a healthy amount of water/swet build up. When I go to sleep and wake up my boots feel like hot towels from the dryer and when I put them on they cool off fast and are 100% dry and fresh (I add a fragrance cleaner spray and goldbond powder for the freshness). I absolutely will not use any other dryer than this! Buy buy buy!!! Zero doubts anymore.
customer_reviews.author: JcG

customer_reviews.title: Warms boots about to be worn.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife who complains of how cold her boots are for her morning drive. After telling me she'd "read the directions" she couldn't understand why the dryer motor could not be heard, why there was no rush of forced air and why her boots remained cold. The directions I read informed me there would be no motor noise, no blowing air. Put her boots back on the dryer, waited 15 minutes and she found the boots warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Must have for hard working men! (&/or women)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is a welder and pipe fitter. Occasionally his boots get soaked at work and trying to dry work boots for the next day was nearly impossible until we bought this dryer! He loves it and hasn’t had an issue with wet boots since. He leaves them on the dryer overnight and they’re good to go in the early morning. It goes a long way to make some of his harder work days more comfortable. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: MCSikes

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad I bought this boot dryer. I've been using it to dry out my boots after work each day. I didn't realize how much nicer they make your boots feel each day. I haven't used it for soaking wet boots yet, but it does great at drying out the sweat that gets in your boots from work. I've been leaving it plugged up 24/7 with no issues. I recommend this product if you have to wear boots everyday like I do. It puts out a decent amount of hot air (more than I thought) without any type of fan. I can honestly see how it could prolong the life on boots and insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this for everyone I know!
customer_reviews.text: Mainly used for my Fox Comp 5 riding boots after I’ve taken a nasty mud bath with my bike. I power wash the outside of them and lightly inside also, set on the dryer. 48 hour turn over and they are DRY and don’t stink! I used to let my boots dry in the boiler room for over a week and they wouldn’t dry and fester all kinds of smells. Coolest thing about this product line is that there is numerous different attachments for helmets for drying and also gloves! Costs close to nothing to run it, and not much for an awsome product. Highly would recommend it anyone and best of all USA made! GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: John Walenga

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: My husband practically lives in work boots. We've thrown away so many pairs through the years that have just been ruined by the elements. Worst of all is having to have multiple pairs for when his current 'good' pair is soaked through. This dryer works as advertised. The day it arrived it poured all day, and his boots were soaked. I plugged it in, wasting countless minutes trying to figure out if it was broken (it IS that silent!) This morning my husband put his boots on exclaiming over how nice, warm, and dry they were. Definitely a worthy purchase, and I'm and ready planning on buying one for my father-in-law as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Not What they Seemed
customer_reviews.text: The boot dryer is not worth the money. It doesn't dry boots in the manner one would imagine, nor does it dry them thoroughly over night. It is desirable to be able to leave boots to dry in a cold place such as a garage or attached shed, but this dryer does not work well in those locations. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnechance

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2013 for my husband, it has been on 24hours a day since we’ve got it, it works perfectly! In the summer my husband feet smell terrible from sweat, and the dryer keeps the boots scent free!! Recently one of he tubes cracked due to our Negligence. Came back just to purchase another one (even though it still works fine when we set the tube together where it cracked, it just falls over and gets annoying!) I Highly recommend it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: No ON/OFF Switch!
customer_reviews.text: I guess you are just supposed to leave it turned on and using electricity all the time because there is no switch on it to shut it off. Maybe they expect you to unplug every day when you take your boots off of it, then plug it back in when you get home and put them back on for the night. Not me, I'm returning it for one like my old unit that has a switch.
customer_reviews.author: smackey02

customer_reviews.title: Good option
customer_reviews.text: This is a good option for getting your boots dry. A couple of things: 1) no power switch - I picked up a timer 2) does not move air - that being said my boots have always been dry in the morning 3) yes it works w western boots. My Ariat Hybrid Rancher H20 were getting a little ripe after a week straight of hard walking in 95 degree weather. Picked this up and no more issue. Dry from toe to heel.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but be extremely gentle!
customer_reviews.text: This product functions as advertised. Made a big difference in drying out my boots in the humid PNW. But, the base of the boot holders have cracked. The left one cracked the entire way through and won't stand up unless against two walls. The right one has a smaller crack. My boots are fairly heavy (I suppose) and I may not have been as careful with the product as perhaps I should have. Regardless, it did not survive 3-4 months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy if you want a decent boot dryer.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE OUR BOOT DRYER... Yes, when you first plug it in, and it warms up, it does have a slight burning smell.. we just kept a close eye on it for the day CHECKING IT OFTEN for the first 2 day's and we didn't leave it plugged in during the night (just incase) after 2 or 3 uses, the smell went away, we now leave it plugged in during the night as we feel comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: It is working!
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting, but good results! when I set up this product. Literally does not make any sound or notification that it’s working, Kinda through me off. I’d like to see an indicator light or something to notify the user its working. But after 8 hrs. Of my work boots on the drier it was completely obvious that it’s been working! Boots where dry inside and out. Would recommend oiling your boots twice as often than you do cause it does dry the leather out a bit. I would say running the product at least 8 hrs. With your boots For good results as recommended by manufacturer is ideal. Night and day difference for stinky sweaty work boots.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how this item works. There's no on and off switch, it circulates the air after it's plugged in. My fiance works in all kinds of weather, he has three pairs off shoes he alternates. The odor in the all the shoes were pretty nasty. After using this dryer in less than a month I noticed his shoes don't have that strong odor like they use to. He puts the shoes on the dryer late afternoon early evening and leaves them on over night. The shoes are dry and warm when he puts them on. There's no noise and to shut it off you have to unplug it. We highly recommend this product, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: So Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dryer for my husband’s Arctic Muck Boots. These boots are designed to keep feet was in extremely cool temperatures. They work so well that his soaks are damp by the end of the day and clearly the inside of the boots need drying. Believe it or not, before we bought this dryer his boot were still damp the next day when he would put them on. The dryer was a game changer! No more damp boots and after months of us, I still haven't heard a sound from this device. I would buy it again and have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Elle S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! Works perfectly. Warm, dry boots every day
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing!! Way cheaper then other brands when it comes to cost but works perfectly. Can dry boots overnight even if covered in wet mud and rain! Super quiet. Actually you don’t even think it is on because it makes zero noise! Don’t fret it is working for sure! It says it deodorizes but I haven’t felt that is the case but honestly it was bought for drying wet boots first. The deodorize was going to be a perk. I will definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these dryers.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says and very handy to have around. I can’t tell you how many of these I have ordered over the years. They make great gifts, especially for unisex family gift exchange games during the holidays. I find most people have never heard of such a product. They get excited when I explain how these work. I put mine in the laundry room, it’s also nice when you wash shoes. My son moved out and took his so I had to order another one. When you need it you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Monique W.

customer_reviews.title: It’s freaking broke.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. It definitely SMELLS burnt and the heat out out is “great” I plugged it in it wouldn’t turn on and after a few minutes the bottom got extremely hot and started smelling like it was going to melt. This is freaking great it was a Christmas present and now I have to send it back. Needless to say I’m PISSED. Update: product works makes zero noise it does get hot so that’s how we new it was working that was all though. Not really worth the money honestly. I’d rather have a fan a heater a light power switch I feel like that would be more reassuring
customer_reviews.author: CBC

customer_reviews.title: Must try! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who works in energy plants, he sweats profusely in Texas heat and his boots get drenched. The smell and sogginess of his boots were horrible, now he gets home puts his boots on this cool contraption and they get dried overnight. You can't hear it, you can't even tell it's on. And it's slim and doesn't take much space. My husband lives in a RV so space is valuable. Our only regret is not purchasing this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Roman

customer_reviews.title: Works well for both athletic and work foot ware, needs timer
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and engineer but is missing one key function. There is no timer for turning the unit off and on. I went to Home Depot and bought a $10 timer switch for turning lights on and off for home security. I use it to set a three hour drying period for my running shoes and a five hour interval for my work boots. off
customer_reviews.author: Jim1949

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: WORTHLESS. I didn’t do enough research before buying this. I guess I was expecting a fan, there’s not one. It stands to reason there would need to be air movement to dry boots, but not with this thing. It plugs in and somehow heats up the tubes...and that’s it. I left my semi-damp boots on this for two days and they were still damp. I promise, the registers on your floor will do a better job than this thing. $40 is a ripoff. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Will buy this again if mine ever breaks
customer_reviews.text: You will never burn a boot with this bad boy. It puts out a warming heat that will slower dry the boots and wont ruin them. I left my soaking wading boots on them for 2 days by the end of day 1 they were dry I was lazy and didn't take them off till the end of day 2 nothing but dry slightly war. Boot. But it takes 10+ hours if you need it dry by next morning get a 110 deg or more boot dryer but you can ruin your boot by leaving on to long
customer_reviews.author: Martin N

customer_reviews.title: Dry boots!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was hurting his feet working in wet boots during the winter. We had a boot dryer that was $12 on sale but it did not do its job and was loud. I wasn't expecting a lot out of this but was pleasantly surprised. My husband puts them on the dryer before he goes to bed and they're dry upon waking. They don't make the house stink like dirty wet feet like our other either, in fact I think his boots even smell better in general. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J.P,

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY WE HAVE DRY BOOTS NOW
customer_reviews.text: So I saw that this item got mixed reviews but it doesn’t deserve it. This heater works great I bought it for my boyfriend who’s a plumber, he get his boots soaking wet or covered in crap has to go wash them off completely then sets them on her soaking wet. By the time he has to wear them the next morning they are dry completely and warm. He’s started putting my shoes on it in the morning for me LOL but it’s truly a boot warmer not slip on shoes warmer. Also my shoes never get wet so I don’t have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing!  If you have kids in sports-order this!!
customer_reviews.text: We have struggled for years with stinky cleats since our kids both play soccer. I heard about this product and ordered it and have been using it for my kids tennis shoes and cleats and they no longer get stinky! I am thrilled and know that this will help us keep their shoes around longer. Thank you Peet Dryer for creating an affordable product that solves a big problem! I'll be ordering another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Sharona

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I lived without this!
customer_reviews.text: If you have kids and live in a place that gets snow, you need this! Dries soaking wet boots overnight. We also use it when we wash tennis shoes. My only regret is that I didn't buy the 4 shoe dryer. Will definitely be getting that this winter. We also purchased the glove attachment. I think it would work for adult gloves, but the attachment was too large for my kids' gloves.
customer_reviews.author: R.N. SAHM

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It dries soaked boots over night and slightly wet boots in a couple hours or so. Sometimes you have to remove the insoles so the water can evaporate in between the insole and bottom of the shoe depending on the boot. My regular work boots don’t require I do that, but when I left my rubber boots outside and it rained and filled them up with water I had to do that. They still got dry overnight though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have two now!
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. This is my second one as my son has taken over my other one. Nothing like putting on warm shoes or slippers on a cold winter day. Also helps with my sons shoes as his feet sweat constantly. His shoes could clear out a room when he takes them off! These last forever as well. I wouldn't buy an off brand...you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: kidd3791

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday morning and now I’m using it for the first time. I’m bought this for my boxing gloves boots, shoes BUT mainly for my boxing gloves. The Heat put out is sufficient and it’s not too hot, just enough to dry it. It’s really quiet to, can’t even hear it. My gloves are smelling better already and is warm when I put my hands inside. Nice product and I would recommend this✊🏿👊🏿
customer_reviews.author: Tony Sesco

customer_reviews.title: Love this product totally!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pair of hiking boots that get soaking wet. I used to have to switch them out every other day, and even then, they weren't always totally dry. Now I can dry a pair totally overnight and start out with dry feet. Love my boot dryer. I know what my family members are getting for Christmas 😁 Pros: No noise Dries soaking wet hiking boots completely overnight! Toasty warm the next day :) Cons: None that I've noticed. Love it! I use it every night after work. Boots are toasty and dry when I put them on the next day. Update: I've had this boot warmer for almost a year and still absolutely LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: EC H.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, feels a bit cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking in fall/winter/spring in the Pacific Northwest, and that means wet boots. Even when they’re completely soaked through, I just put them on the dryer and they’re dry by the next day. My only complaint is that it feels a little cheap. It’s made of very lightweight and flimsy feeling plastic and doesn’t feel like the type of thing that will last for 20 years, but who knows - I’ve only had it a few months!
customer_reviews.author: Brock Jones

customer_reviews.title: Been a customer for 9 years
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My last one worked for 9 years and never malfunctioned. I stepped on my old one while moving and broke it. My new one works great. I spray a little Lysol in my work boots and running shoes then put them on the Peet Dryer over night. The Peet Dryer is silent, doesn't over heat, perfect product. Not a single complaint for over 9 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Jn.Vanek26

customer_reviews.title: Takes time
customer_reviews.text: Friend of mine told me about the dryer, May take 24 hours to dry. Were talking wading boots.The good thing about this dryer is it does what it says. I have no complaints. Used to take a lot longer to dry when boots were left in garage, didn't smell good either. Update; after 24 hours later the boots were dry and smelled good too, LOL. Definitely a must have if you have wading boots to dry. These boots spend hours under water.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: A co-worker recommended this product and after reading the reviews I figured ...
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I was a little skeptical at first. I work construction and my steel toed boots frequently end up soaked. A co-worker recommended this product and after reading the reviews I figured why not, if it doesn't work I could just return it. That being said this dryer is fantastic. It dries my boots overnight no matter how wet they have gotten. I was also surprised that it fits different brands perfectly. Will absolutely recommend to friends and co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: It’s silent but efficient.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my boyfriend who works in construction. He’s outside all winter long and he complained of wet boots for months before I had this sent to him. He has reported that it does what it says! I was skeptical at first because this machine makes NO NOISE whatsoever so I assumed it wasn’t doing anything. But I guess it’s supposed to be silent and gets the boots dry anyway. He’s happy, I’m happy :-)
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Feuerstein

customer_reviews.title: silent, sturdy, suitable for large shoes sizes
customer_reviews.text: It been great so far. This dryer has no motor, which means- no noise. We have a newborn at home and I appreciate this a lot. We use it for a few weeks overnight on working military style boots size 16 - they are nice and dry every morning consistently. (My husband is in lumber delivery business, it is a lot of sweat and 10-14 hrs of shoes wearing)...dryer is plastic but not fragile and vertical design saves me some space.
customer_reviews.author: Alena Nodzomi

customer_reviews.title: Like putting on new boots every morning.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I work in a hot warehouse and my boots smelled awful from sweating. I tried a million different odor removing sprays and shoe inserts and none of them worked. I was very skeptical that this would work, but low and behold it worked amazing! My boots are dry and smell like a normal pair of boots now every time I put them on in the morning. Also the device is absolutely silent, and doesn't get hot. If you work hard and have work boots that smell like you work hard, than this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Saved me
customer_reviews.text: After doing extensive research for smelly shoes I stumbled upon this product and immediately purchased it for my husband. I love my husband but his work boots kept me up at night. I literally could not sleep with the ugly smell... I had tried a lot of things... washing them, air drying, baking soda.. etc etc.. and nothing works like the PEET dryer. I would purchase this product even if it was 3 times it's original cost.. it is totally worth it!!! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and useful product
customer_reviews.text: My husband works outdoors in all seasons and his steel toe boots usually get soaked during rainy days. Getting this PEET dryer helps so much. All you do is put your shoes/boots on the supporters and plug in the device. It doesn't have any switches and starts working in a few minutes. When my husband used it for the first time he said his boots were completely dry in the morning (had them on the dryer overnight). Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I got one for myself and have since ordered 3 more for family members, especially since they live in snow and/or rain-prone areas. They haven't received them yet, so we'll see what they think. Meanwhile, I like the dryer and am using it constantly. Every time I take off a pair of shoes I rotate them onto the dryer and put the previous pair on my shoe rack. Although I'm not in a very cold place (except for right now--brrr), it's nice to put my feet into nice warm shoes. Hopefully it cuts down on shoe odor--so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonas

customer_reviews.title: Are my feet too big?
customer_reviews.text: My feet are size 12, I have winter boots that I have put on the PEET Dryer anywhere from 12 to 72 hours. My left toe always gets wet whether or not I step in anything wet or even step outside for that matter, sometimes the right as well. I thought it was because I didn't pull the boots all the way down onto the dryer as far as they would go, but that didn't help at all. I've used this product every day for weeks hoping I was mistaken but there's no denying that it's not operating as it should. Why isn't this product drying my boots? What do all of these 5 star reviewers have that I don't?
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Probably a great product if, you know, it would turn on at all.
customer_reviews.text: I work in wilderness search and rescue and, after a particularly nasty and wet drill in February, I managed to melt a hair dryer while attempting to dry out my boots. So, I purchased this thing, hoping that it would solve the issue (and, you know, reduce the amount of money that needs to be spent on hair dryers). Finally had the chance to try it today and... it doesn't turn on. Wish I could write a longer review for it but, alas, it just plain doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Berg

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY, WASTE OF MONEY, PLASTIC GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product specifically says uses "convection technology" to draw air in and circulate to dry your shoes. Last I checked a convection oven has a fan that circulates the hot air around the oven this $50 plastic piece of crap has no fan just some heating elements that are meant to "draw" air in which they dont. I'd return it and get my money back but it sat in the box for 3 months till i finally needed it so well past return times. Wish I could give negative stars
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Just...WOW.
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly impressed! You can't hear this thing at all! i Honestly thought it was broken at first, but it definitely works. Although i'm sure whoever invented this thing is a Wizard. Supposedly no heaters/coils, no moving parts or fans etc, but yet somehow my boots are always warm and dry and you can feel the air moving a little bit when you put your hands near it. Needless to say I LOVE IT. Thanks for a good honest inexpensive product!
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Dryer take away odor and makes your shoe experience better..
customer_reviews.text: Had this PEET dryer since last Oct 2017...have used it extensively .... from drying motorcycle helmets...Gloves...Boots...and Dress shoes, have gotten great results great to feel warm dry shoes with no smell at all. The glove drying accessory needs a little re engineering work so that the gloves fit and dry better. Still using my Peet Dryer going on to almost a year... still working great. Nothing like odorless dry shoes. This product was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Hernandez Mencia

customer_reviews.title: Very fast drying time
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my son's soccer shoes. He puts them on after practice/games and they dry out within a few hours. Highly recommend for any sports player parent who doesn't want to deal with smelly shoes/skates. Combine this with a scent killer spray and say goodbye to stomach churning, smelly shoes forever.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: ... contractor and has always come home from work with horribly smelly feet
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a independent contractor and has always come home from work with horribly smelly feet. I got this for him for Christmas and have already noticed a huge difference. He puts his boots on this right when he comes home. This product makes no sound at all and it doesn’t take up a lot of room. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Gerlach

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet but works very well
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this boot dryer . Very simple . I opened the box and put it together . Plugged it in. It seemed like it didn't work. No lights , silent . So I decided to throw my boots over it anyway . The next day before shift . I checked my boots , warm and dry . I couldn't be happier . Nothing worse than wet feet . Highly recommended .
customer_reviews.author: John Pascoe

customer_reviews.title: All Day and Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: I can clean my work boots and rubber boots everyday, soak them with water, soap and vinegar, rinse them out and have them dry on this thing before I wake up the next day. I found completely soaked and slightly dripping boots to be completely dry in as little as 6 hours. This has saved so much time on my routine and makes it easier for me to keep my shoes and boots in better condition. Excellent product that I highly recommend. Also, it's whisper quiet. That's even better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. My boots are dry every morning.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my work boots because my feet sweat something awful at work. When I first plugged it in I thought it needed to be switched on. I didn’t hear or feel anything but I also couldn’t find a switch. I then thought I just have a defective one or something. I checked the instructions one more time and that’s when I saw the part about how quiet it is and the like. So I left it plugged in and the next morning my boots were dry and almost warm. I leave mine on the dryer overnight and every morning I get up, they’re good to go. I would recommend this dryer to people.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This boot dryer works okay but the one I used ...
customer_reviews.text: This boot dryer works okay but the one I used to have, (bought at gander mountain years ago, seemed to have more air flow and dry my shoes faster. I also purchased the glove attachment for this unit and after several hours my gloves were still wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally quiet but working
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers, we thought our unit was broken. We plugged it in and heard no noise at all. The heating element started getting warm quickly however and we realized this was the mechanism that actually dries the shoes, not a fan. Haven't needed to try it out yet, but we're trusting others who have bought this item and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Best boot dryer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best boot dryer ive used, it is absolutely silent, as it uses no fans. There is a heating element in in the middle of each tube, this heats the air, as the hot air rises into the boot room temp air is draw in to take its place. Works like a charm. I have used it every day for almost a year and it works fantastic. I bought an auto shut-off timer, that the dryer is plugged into. That way it will dry for a set length of time (i use 4 hrs) and shut off on its own, so you cant forget and leave it on all night. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Telma Frumholtz

customer_reviews.title: Broke after four months. Go with another brand.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have sweaty feet and work outside in Arizona. It works great for drying boots overnight. Unfortunately one of the legs broke at the base after only four months and it is totally unusable. So much for American quality. I'll be buying a cheap Chinese version of the same thing for less than I'll have to pay in shipping to have this one maybe replaced under warranty. Also no off switch is highly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Can dry soaking wet shoes/boots in a day or less. Makes NO sound (no fan; works on convection). Set on hard surface (not carpet) for maximum air flow. Takes a couple of hours to completely dry my fabric shoes that I wear in wet grass in the morning. Takes a bit longer to dry out my son & husband's work/snow/ski boots. Directions recommend plugging in ahead of time but I found that unnecessary. No shut off switch, so locate it where it's easy to plug/unplug. I have it behind a chair in our family room.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda J.

customer_reviews.title: Made in U.S.A. with a Wonderful, Zero Sound, Leave-Your-Stinky-A$$ Shoes Smelling Neutral Design
customer_reviews.text: No fan equals no noise. Just gentle, low temperature heat that naturally rises thru drying tubes and dries that lawn mowing/ wet soccer field/ working on non-air conditioned shop floor with thick socks, sweaty/ juicy/ swampy boots/ shoes/ cleats smelling nice and neutral. Would recommend to all ages that wear shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Dries bots efficiently and quietly. I’ve read some of the reviews where people did not think it worked because it doesn’t make a sound. This is how the machine operates.......very quietly!! This boot dryer was purchased for my teenage son who gets his boots wet at his job. We own two of these. My husbands is 20 years old and still going strong!! Great product, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Boot dryer and no more smell
customer_reviews.text: For years when I took my boots off the smell would knock you over. I was told about this boot dryer and decided to give it a try. I was amazed that this unit not only dried my boots but the smell was gone also. It runs so quiet that your not sure it is working, but it is. If you want to help extend the life of your boots. keep them dry and help eliminate odor - I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happily surprised
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I thought that it produced air and when I got it I was nervous that it wouldnt work because it does not move air however it works very very well. We use this for my boyfriends leather work boots (hes a landscaper so his shoes are soaked) he used this after a 50 hour work week and they are working really well. No noise, no smell, j cant even tell it's on and the shoes are drying very well
customer_reviews.author: madalynn harvin

customer_reviews.title: Boot dryer for any shoe, any season
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot dryer for my husband who loves it but I honestly use it more and not just for boots! It works great on my husbands bulky work and hunting boots. I use it for my winter boots and for my slip on shoes. In the summer my slip on Tom's get pretty sweaty and anyone who owns a pair knows how stinky they can get. I put them on the boot dryer over night and they are completely dry in the morning and it really cuts down the smell.
customer_reviews.author: hollieh

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I would equate this to an Easy Bake Oven, but an incandescent light bulb provides more heat. After leaving my boots on all night, they are barely above room temperature. This thing simply isn't worth the $45 I paid for it. I cannot recommend this to anyone. The heat output is very low, it doesn't heat up enough to remove any scents, but the only shining point - it is quiet because it has no moving parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dera Burkes

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!  Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for a Christmas gift and never did I think it would be put to a test so soon! Ironically my adult son was goofing around with his "good" sneakers on and fell into a creek 3 days ago, so this Peet Dryer was put to the test! He is extremely careful with his sneakers, always cleaning them etc...He put his soaked sneakers on the dryer and it passed my son's very picky test! The shoes were completely dry and not ounce of odor was detected. Needless to say, this gift was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Neff

customer_reviews.title: silent low wattage boot dryer for sports, cool, or wet climates
customer_reviews.text: Already have a timer based portable boot dryer that is good, but the PEET original electric dryer is superior provided you have the extra time. Pros: very low energy profile, measured at 34 or 35 watts using a KilliWatt meter, sturdy enough to accomodate heavier boots without tipping over, SILENT, 25 year warranty, additional attachements available for larger gloves and helmets/hats, fair price. Very minor cons: no on lamp or on/off switch, but thoose would probably wear out before 25 years. Needs more time to dry than blower style dryers that use generally five to six times the energy but risk adhesive seperation in some footwear. Plastic base and extensions seem less than ideal, but they work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Avg Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good gift for a service member/runner
customer_reviews.text: Only wish I had one earlier. Great gift to any service member or runner. Noiseless. Boots dry, no more smells, and warm at perfect temp. My advice: Wish it had a on/off switch on the cord instead of unplugging from the outlet. Prob safe left on and uses little power, I just dont like the idea of it plugged in when not in use and/or slipped my mind. A few dollars more to the price would be reasonable for one.
customer_reviews.author: eartheditor

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must have.
customer_reviews.text: An absolute must have if you live in the cold. I work in the snow, rain, and mundane when I get home from work I throw my boots on this. Within an hour or two there dry and any smell is eliminated. The power consumption isn't noticeable and there is no noise. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, we got a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: Have used daily for about 2 yrs now. Still works great. We put work shoes/work boots on dryer when we get home & in morning they are slighty warm, totally dry. No more athletes foot problems, no more funky shoe/foot odor. Pull work shoes off & put home shoes on it when we get ready for work. We have a dryer for each of us. Drys gloves great also.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Roberts

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: So before I drove a truck and made deliveries I thought one of these was a poor idea.... well after my boots being wet for 3 days straight and having to wear sneakers to work i broke down and bought one. I'm glad I did. I'll be buying another one for my dad this xmas
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Sobetsky

customer_reviews.title: If you wear boots, you must own this product.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't just for wet boots, its for daily drying use. When you take your boots off, your sweat takes a while to dry. This causes bacteria to grow and stink the heck outa your boots. Even if my boot are soaked through from romping around in knee high H20, these never fail to dry them by morning. I stick my Thorogoods on these every day after work and wake up to dry, warm and ODORLESS boots. You are doing it wrong if you don't own this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Rindskopf

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Ironworkers and all of the other trades.
customer_reviews.text: Been using the Peet boot dryer for years. My last one was broken by one of my careless doggies. If not for getting damaged I think it probably would of lasted forever. Love this product. I'm an Ironworker in Chicago and wear quality boots. The Peet dryer is a definite to protect your investment. Boots are dry and comfy every morning and dont stink. A must have for tradesmen and trades women who work on their feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Jurich

customer_reviews.title: Get it now.
customer_reviews.text: I've been in construction for almost 20 years but been have wet footwear almost all my life. I've been told hundreds and hundreds of times that I should get a boot dryer but do I listen? No. It took me years to try one. I'm so glad it was this one. I'll never go without one for as long as I live now. It does exactly what it claims to do. My boots are completely wet after work and by early morning they are dry and toasty. Its like coffee for my feet. Helps gets it going. I recommend getting one. Don't be a fool like me and wait over half your life. Get it now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We own a trout farm - our boots are wet daily. This gets used daily - and has held up amazingly. It drys and even warms our boots (yes, it says nothing about warming - but when our booths come off of this - they are warm and amazing!) I would definitely buy again and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S.

customer_reviews.title: takes forever
customer_reviews.text: i understand rapid drying can cause problems but im not even sure if this drier works or when it is or is not on due to the lack of, well anything. No indicator light for on, not air movement (a key to any dry out of anything) no heat that i could tell at least and it didnt dry my boots. Ive owned the other kind that moves air and heat and thats the way to go IMO. this is just like setting them by a window; even thats being generous.
customer_reviews.author: Shane N.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AWESOME!!! works like a charm. I only wish that I owned it last month, prior to my 4 year old deciding that it would be a good idea to pour all of her little sisters baby powder in my work boots, and add a glass of water for good measure! I obviously had to wash my Red wings out and totally soak them, took over a week in front of the fireplace. Nowadays. after a wet day at work, I just throw them on there when I get home, and they're totally dry by morning.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works indoors, at room temperature only.
customer_reviews.text: This dryer works as intended as long as the room temperature is warm enough. I first tried to use in in a covered patio where the temperature is between 40-50 °F and my boots were cold and damp after 8 hours. Then I moved it into the house and 2 hours later the boots were warm and dry. And I could actually feel warm air coming out of the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my shoes and nose
customer_reviews.text: I run long training runs here in Florida. I frequently end up with soaked shoes from either sweat or rain. This dryer works like a charm. All I do is slip my shoes on the tubes and plug it in. I have perfectly dry non-smelly shoes in a matter of hours. There are no moving parts to make any noise or wear out. The one improvement I would suggest is an on/off switch. You could take care of this by using a power strip. Note: I have also used this to dry shoes after washing them in the washing machine. This helps the shoes maintain their shape and not distort in the dryer. I consider this an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: Love warm shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for Christmas. I wasn't sure what to think about it at first, but now I love it. I manage a restaurant and often come home with wet shoes. I also get cold easily. When I get home from work, I put my shoes on the PEET Dryer. By the next morning, they are dry and warm. Even if they are not wet, I put them on the dryer. Toasty warm shoes feel so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Odelia M. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It will dry out your boots.
customer_reviews.text: I got one years ago for a Christmas present. I liked mine so much I bought one for my son. If you live in the north and / or wear rubber boots alot, this unit works. Uses very little energy, but the thing really drys out your boots. Whether its work boots, rubber boots or snow boots, this will dry em out. Remember, your feet will sweat inside boots even if your boots don't leak. Put them on the dryer over night and they will be bone dry in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My husband had talked about needing something like this so I ordered it for Christmas. He LOVES it. And uses it still in June/July with all of our rain. (He’s in the pool industry too..) It is so quiet that I don’t even know when he has it plugged in unless his boots are on it!
customer_reviews.author: KypressDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: This product has been wonderful for drying my work boots. As a gardener in Atlanta, I work in rain year-round. I keep the PEET dryer plugged up in the garage so when I get home I can place my boots on there immediately. I’ve also used it to dry out my sweaty running shoes. No noise, no excessive heat. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hubby who hunts and is outside all the time, one of his hunting buddies has this and recommended it to him... Well we were not real sure what to expect, I mean when you get a $200 pair of boots wet on the inside most of the time ITS OVER. So my husband came in from a rainy day in the woods and mud the whole nine yards he put the boots on the dryer and BOOM the very next morning the were completely DRY... Now he uses this thing every time its cold or wet outside... We liked this so much we ordered two more for Christmas presents for our dads....
customer_reviews.author: Biddy

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than an 18 year old boy's feet.
customer_reviews.text: My son's feet stink! He works at a farm and when he comes home after 10 hours he is very dirty and smelly. His work boots are the worst. This does an amazing job. We put it in the garage and it works overnight. It is silent and removes the odors. Now if I can just train my son to put his boots on it when he gets home.
customer_reviews.author: KTO 2.0

customer_reviews.title: This works for my sweaty feet!
customer_reviews.text: This really works. I have sweaty feet. I use inserts, I rotate my shoes, but there's still some moisture and that's where Peet's dryer comes in. It totally dries your shoes overnight. I like also how the shoes are slightly warm when you put them on early in the morning right off the rack, kind of a bonus. You will be surprised from how much of a difference it makes when your shoes are bone dry, it really neutralizes the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Cargill

customer_reviews.title: Work outside? Wet boots? Solution here!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my brother. He works in the freezing cold windy winters in MI for 8+ hours and always comes home with soaked boots. He puts his boots right on these bad boys and they are toasty warm in the morning. Keeps his boots in tip-top condition and doesn’t get too hot. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely Sydney Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Still a great product,even after 30yrs!
customer_reviews.text: Still a great product, won't go without one. This is the second one I purchased,the first in 1990,still works great! A must have if you work outside Dry boots are the only way to go,whether it's from sweat,or the elements.
customer_reviews.author: David R Silva

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: It works. I keep it next to my shoe rack, but it's pretty unsightly. It does take a full night (roughly 12 hours) to dry your boots/shoes. I have used it to dry my steel toe work boots (from sweating) and shoes that get soaked in the rain (dripping & squeaking & leaving puddles with every step).
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: but it does a pretty amazing job
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical whether this thing would be practical when I bought it, but it does a pretty amazing job. My old boots that I wore almost daily were constantly getting dosed with foot powders to dry them out and deal with athlete's foot problems and this thing pretty much eliminated that. It was an odoriferous experience the first couple nights though putting my old boots on there, however as they continued being used with the dryer they continued to eliminate the odor until it was almost non-existent. I've since replaced my old boots and use this now with my new boots to keep them dry and ready for use the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other reviews say, it’s completely silent, you can just plug it in and forget about it, electric bill hasn’t changed, for those wondering how to tell if it’s on or not, plug it in and wait 30 minutes and you should be able to feel a faint warmth coming out the vent. I frequently work in the rain and in mud, no matter how soaking wet my boots are, if I pop them on the dryer when I get home, the next morning they’re completely dry through and through.
customer_reviews.author: lance pena

customer_reviews.title: So quiet!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these now. My husband and 2 boys use it every day. My husband puts his leather work boots on the dryer every night. It keeps them dry, the leather soft and plyable and keeps the stinky foot smell out of my house finally!! Makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Would not ever want to be without one.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one. The first, I lost in a divorce (true story). The second is still being used and it is in its tenth year. Now this one is for my new wife to use because one just is never enough. This style of boot dryer will work for years without ever needing to unplug it. I use on every shoe and boot I have. As soon as the shoe comes off, it goes right on the dryer to keep them fresh. Great for the ski boots and inline skates as well. I highly recommend them for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: George Powitz

customer_reviews.title: I work outside in the Great Lakes region
customer_reviews.text: I work outside in the Great Lakes region. Warm dry boots in the morning are a wonderful thing. I has me spoiled. The only drawback is that this model doesn't have an on/off switch so it has to plugged/unplugged. I resolved this by using a switched power strip. It would be a great gift for anyone who works in inclement weather.
customer_reviews.author: c. tolson

customer_reviews.title: Super Quiet and Works
customer_reviews.text: It works. Amazed. It doesn't make any noise. I would prefer it if there was an on/off switch and/or if it had an on light to prove it's on. I can leave shoe's over night and they will be warm and dry and not hot. The first time or 2 I wasn't sure if it was working. It's not fast, more of an overnighter, but won't roast the rubber in the shoes, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: B Man

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: My husband works long hours in the snow and his boots when he comes home are always wet and get a horrible funk. He puts his boots on the dryer and they are dry and don't smell in the morning when he puts them on. He said it was one of the best gifts ever!
customer_reviews.author: Deidra Boyd

customer_reviews.title: It's snowing again.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boot dryer for a friend who is tired of sticking his foot in a wet boot at 4:30 am. We have had a crap load of snow here in Iowa this winter, and shoveling out seems to be a way of life for now. This boot dryer so far, has done a great job of drying his boots. He has also had it all of one night. This boot dryer was delivered on time and was a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Silent.
customer_reviews.text: Work exactly as advertised. Silent operation, and they dry the boots well without too much heat that could make them dry too quickly and shrink them. The only little negative is that it feels a bit cheap. I haven't had any problems with them tipping or anything, just being complete in my review. I use them every day after work and haven't had a problem in the month or so I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: lefthandedrighty

customer_reviews.title: Great overnight dryer
customer_reviews.text: So when you plug it in it basically doesn’t make a noise or get warm right off the bat. But don’t panic- it’s intended for overnight usage and will get warm (never hot) enough to dry out my wettest boots. In the morning are dry, warm and clean smelling boots that waiting for you. If you’re wanting something quicker than overnight then you’ll need to look for forced heated air as this one just uses gravity to take up the hot air into your boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clay

product_meta.title: PEET Dryer - Original 2-Shoe Electric Dryer, Black
feature_bullets: WORKS SILENTLY: The Original 2-Shoe Dryer works silently by gently warming air that rises and dries footwear; No loud fans blowing hot air
DRIES MOST FOOTWEAR OVERNIGHT: Drying time depends on material and saturation level; We recommend leaving shoes on the dryer overnight for best results
ALWAYS ON: Simply leave it plugged in 24/7; The Original 2-Shoe Dryer uses less electricity than a low wattage household light bulb and costs just pennies a day
SAFE ON ALL MATERIALS: Safe to use on leather, rubber, vinyl, neoprene, canvas, synthetics, fleece, microfiber and more
25-YEAR WARRANTY: Our products are designed to last and we're confident that your PEET Dryer will exceed expectations for years; Register within 10 days of purchase to take advantage of our warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,089 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
